risks: Viewport width edge cases with clamp()
Potential overflow on very small screens

detailed_analysis.root_cause: The .hero-title has min-height: 6rem but uses clamp(2.5rem, 8vw, 5rem) for font-size. The typing animation cycles through phrases of varying lengths ('Engineering Lead' vs 'Machine Learning Researcher'), causing layout shifts when the text wraps to multiple lines on smaller viewports.
detailed_analysis.solution_approach: Increase min-height to accommodate longest phrase at all viewport sizes, or implement fixed height with overflow handling. The 6rem min-height is insufficient for multi-line text scenarios.
testing_requirements: Verify all typing phrases fit without overflow
Check layout stability during animation cycles
Validate accessibility with different font sizes
detailed_analysis.implementation_strategy: CSS-only solution using calculated min-height based on longest phrase length and responsive font scaling. No JavaScript changes required.

issue_title: Bug: Hero section moves up and down when typing animation changes text length
